quoteFirst: The female showed increasing inclination to climb, raising her head and forebody against the trunks of saplings, and finally reaching up one to a branch 20 inches above the ground, and climbing first along the branch and then farther up the main trunk. As she progressed the male was lifted from the ground, dangling limply suspended by his hemipenis and its base had become exposed. At
quoteLast: separation occurred and the male dropped into the grass. Semen dripped from the cloacae of both snakes. That from the female was tinged with blood.
title: Natural History of the Racer Coluber constrictor
author: Fitch, Henry S. (Henry Sheldon), 1909-2009

quoteLast: on the ninth a CAA employee at the airport was walking across the ramp in front of the administration building. He happened to glance up at the sky--why, he didn't know--and out of the corner of his eye he caught a flash of light on the southeastern horizon.
title: The Report on Unidentified Flying Objects
author: Ruppelt, Edward J., 1922-1960
